meanings.sent1: The loud music from the party next door was so rebarbative that I couldn't concentrate on my homework.
meanings.sent2: The constant buzzing of the mosquito was rebarbative, making it impossible to fall asleep.
meanings.sent3: The rebarbative sound of nails on a chalkboard made everyone cringe at the school assembly.
meanings.sent4: The rebarbative smell of rotten eggs filled the room, causing everyone to cover their noses.
meanings.sent5: The rebarbative taste of the medicine lingered in my mouth long after I swallowed it.

meanings.sent1: The abandoned house had a rebarbative appearance, with broken windows and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent2: The slimy texture of the food was so rebarbative that I couldn't take another bite.
meanings.sent3: The rebarbative sight of the garbage dump made me appreciate the beauty of nature even more.
meanings.sent4: The rebarbative color combination of bright pink and neon green clashed horribly in the painting.
meanings.sent5: The rebarbative design of the old couch made it clear why it was left out on the curb.
